long long next_i(long long current_i) {

    char s[20];

    sprintf(s, "%lld", current_i);

    int len = strlen(s);

    char new_str[20];

    int new_len = 0;

    int f = 0;

    for (int j = 0; j < len; j++) {

        char c = s[len - 1 - j]; // the j-th character from the end.

        if (!f) {

            if (c == '3') {

                new_str[new_len++] = '5';

                f = 1;

            } else if (c == '5') {

                new_str[new_len++] = '7';

                f = 1;

            } else {

                new_str[new_len++] = '3';

            }

        } else {

            new_str[new_len++] = c;

        }

    }

    if (!f) {

        new_str[new_len++] = '3';

    }

    // Now reverse new_str to get the next number.

    char reversed[20];

    for (int k = 0; k < new_len; k++) {

        reversed[k] = new_str[new_len - 1 - k];

    }

    reversed[new_len] = '\0';

    return atoll(reversed);

}

        else if (s[k] == '7') has7 = 1;

    }

    if (has3 && has5 && has7) c++;

    // compute next i.

    i = next_i(i);

Putting it all together:

The full C code would be:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    int n;
    scanf("%d", &n);
    int a[n];
    int r = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &a[i]);
        r ^= a[i];
    }
    int b[n];
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        b[i] = r ^ a[i];
    }
    long long N = b[0];
    long long i = 357;
    int c = 0;
    while (i <= N) {
        // Check if contains 3,5,7
        char s[20];
        sprintf(s, "%lld", i);
        int has3 = 0, has5 = 0, has7 = 0;
        for (int k = 0; s[k]; k++) {
            if (s[k] == '3') has3 = 1;
            else if (s[k] == '5') has5 = 1;
            else if (s[k] == '7') has7 = 1;
        }
        if (has3 && has5 && has7) c++;
        // Compute next i
        char s_i[20];
        sprintf(s_i, "%lld", i);
        int len = strlen(s_i);
        char new_str[20];
        int new_len = 0;
        int f = 0;
        for (int j = 0; j < len; j++) {
            char c_char = s_i[len - 1 - j];
            if (!f) {
                if (c_char == '3') {
                    new_str[new_len++] = '5';
                    f = 1;
                } else if (c_char == '5') {
                    new_str[new_len++] = '7';
                    f = 1;
                } else {
                    new_str[new_len++] = '3';
                }
            } else {
                new_str[new_len++] = c_char;
            }
        }
        if (!f) {
            new_str[new_len++] = '3';
        }
        char reversed[20];
        for (int k = 0; k < new_len; k++) {
            reversed[k] = new_str[new_len - 1 - k];
        }
        reversed[new_len] = '\0';
        i = atoll(reversed);
    }
    printf("%d\n", c);
    return 0;
}
